While en route in poor weather conditions, the aircraft hit the slope of a mountain near the Ouillat Pass, about 5 km north of the Spanish village of Requesens.
the aircraft hit the slope of mountain located near Katagaru, due to a navigational error.
Crashed into Bukit Besar Mountain while en route.
En route, the cargo plane hit the slope of a mountain located 12 km from Yalí.

Crashed into hills shortly after takeoff. Crew error. The pilot taking off under VFR, lost visual contact with the ground and attempted to return to IFR procedure too late to avoid the hills. The aircraft was named "City of Ayudhya."
On final approach to Río Grande Airport, the aircraft stalled and crashed in a fieldlshort of runway.

The inability of the aircraft to gain height shortly after becoming airborne, due to loss of engine power caused by ice formation in the carburetor intakes attributable to the captain's failure to make use of the heat controls.
On final approach to Techo Airport, the aircraft went out of control and crashed in an explosion short of runway.
The pilot lost control of the aircraft while attempting too steep a turn and too  low a speed while making an approach at night in dense fog and rain and struck the ground.
The plane encountered poor weather conditions with thunderstorm activity and turbulence leading to loss of control and crash.
The cargo plane hit the slope of a mountain.
Crashed during a landing attempt in adverse weather conditions under VFR and hit high ground. The pilot attempted a visual approach and made a turn at low altitude in adverse weather conditions.
The cargo plane crashed in a field while attempting to land..
Hit a tree while taking off and crashed.
Lost control and crashed when attempting to take off. Attempted to take off  with the autopilot engaged.
Crashed shortly after takeoff from La Paz-El Alto Airport.
While en route, the aircraft hit the slope of the Cerro Blanco.
While en route in clouds, the airplane crashed on Mt Ingeli  about 17 km southeast of Kokstad.
Went missing en route. No trace of the aircraft was ever found.
Crashed while en route.
Crashed into a sand dune while attempting to land in poor weather condtions.
Shortly after taking and while in an initial climb, the plane hit an obstacle and crashed.
While flying in a narrow valley, the pilot elected to gain height when the aircraft hit trees and crashed in flames. Pilot error.
Crashed at Mehrabad airport during a third landing attempt. The pilot attempted to land despite warnings of poor visibility and snow.
The cargo plane crashed on takeoff after hitting trees.

In-flight failure of a propeller which damaged control cables causing loss of control of the aircraft. The control cables in the fuselage were sheared by the right propeller which broke loose following a shaft failure caused by the sudden stopping of the engine caused by fatigue failure of No. 6 piston lug.

The right wing struck trees after attempting a go-around. Pilot error.
While taking off, the cargo plane, carrying a light load of freight, lost altitude and crashed into a house.
Crashed into the summit on Cerro Grande Mountain.
Crashed during takeoff. The plane hit an unidentified obstruction on the runway and the wheels collapsed.
The cargo plane, carrying a load of tea,  crashed while taking off after losing an engine and attempting an emergency landing.
Lost an engine while on approach and crashed. Fuel starvation caused when the plane banked to make a turn and the tank being used had very little fuel in it.
Crashed on a mountain slope while en route. There were mainly whaling crews aboard, returning from the antarctic. Crew navigational error.

Crashed while attempting to make an emergency landing after experiencing an engine failure. Failure of the port engine due to accessory drive failure. Failure of the starboard engine due to seizure as a result of deficient maintenance. Error on the part of the crew in lowering the landing gear in emergency conditions.
The cargo plane lost an engine while taking off, stalled and crashed. Failure of maintenance staff to remove the flying control locks.  Failure of one engine for reason undetermined.
Crashed into the North Sea near Holy Island while participating in North Atlantic Treaty maneuvers.
Exploded in midair. A bomb exploded aboard.

A navigational error on the part of the captain. This error was severely aggravated by the lack of proper radio aids from the destination airport, the unserviceability of the aircraft R/T equipment, and to a lesser degree the physical condition of the crew. The secondary cause was the cargo plane coming into close proximity of high ground due to the captains uncertainty of his position.
The aircraft crashed into the Sea of Japan while en route. No signs of the wreckage were ever found and only two bodies were recovered when they washed ashore.

Disappeared over the Atlantic. Never found.
Crashed while landing.

After takeoff from Laoag an armed man forced his way into the cockpit. He pulled .45-caliber pistol and demanded that the plane be brought to Amoy, in mainland China. The captain took over control from the co-pilot and put the plane into a steep dive. The hijacker did not lose his balance and instead shot and killed the captain. The co-pilot took over control and meanwhile the steward had come up to the cockpit to find out what was going on. As he knocked, the hijacker shot him twice through the cockpit door, killing him. The co-pilot changed course to China and continued at 6000 feet over the China Sea until two Chinese Nationalists T-6 Harvard planes showed up. Both planes chased the DC-3 and sprayed machine gun fire. The pilot managed to escape until he met with other Nationalist planes, who forced the flight to land at Quemoy. At Quemoy the hijacker was arrested.
Destroyed by detonation of a bomb.
Crashed into a mountain while en route in severe weather. The pilot descended in poor visibility in order to find his position.

The pilot aborted the takeoff after loosing the No. 2 engine and was unable to stop on the remaining runway. Error of judgment on the part of the pilot in not continuing the takeoff with three engines still operating

Crashed after a wing failed due to metal fatigue cracks after the aircraft encountered strong winds. A wrong type of grease used when fitting press fit bolts to the booms caused corrosion, thus weakening the lower starboard boom at the outboard bolt hole.
The cargo plane crashed on take off after experiencing duel engine failure.

Lost an engine on takeoff, climbed to 100-200 ft. entering a slight banking turn and crashed into the sea. Failure of the left engine which was due to the cracking of the accessory drive gear. Failure of the pilot to take precautionary steps on hearing the back firing, which was a warning of possible engine failure.

The cargo plane broke apart in midair and crashed in the Khasi hills. The port wing failed in the air due to an upload as a result of being subjected to loads greater than those for which it was designed.
Crashed after takeoff due to wing failure.

Crashed while attempting to land.  Misuse of controls after the aircraft touched down on the water. The aircraft  bounced several times with the final bounce being so severe the nose section was torn off.
Crashed into the San Ramone mountains while attempting to land in poor weather.
Crashed after taking off. Engine fire.
Crashed after on-board fire.  Possibly shot down.
The cargo plane flew into a mountain east of San Diego.
The cargo plane struck a tower in fog while attempting to land. Too low approach.
The cargo plane crashed under unknown circumstances.
Crashed into the Rodeo Pampa mountains during an approach to Sucre, 18 miles from its destination.
The cargo plane with a load of citrus fruit flew into a 8,000 ft. mountain.
Crashed on takeoff from Cairo-Almaza Airport.
Flew into a mountain near Lapseki.
The jet fighter crashed into homes killing 6 people and destroying 3 homes while attempting to land at Long Beach Airport..
Crashed and burned on Friar's Peak in the Salinas mountains after being waved off for landing due to a dust storm.
The cargo plane crashed into the Red River while on final approach.
Stalled and crashed and burned during takeoff.
The aircraft deviated from its normal course by 30 miles and struck the slope of Mt Cipóa. Navigational error. The minimum safety height for the route was not complied with.
The cargo plane ran off the end of the runway and crashed after being attacked by a fighter jet.

compañia: Soc. de Tr. Aériens d'Extrême Orient
resumen: Crashed en route under unknown circumstances..
The cargo plane crashed en route.
Stalled and crashed during a test flight.
Disappeared over the Andes while en route. Wreckage found 12/04/1954.
Crashed in the jungle about 30 km north of Luang Prabang on the company's first commercial flight.
The cargo plane crashed into a mountain while en route.
Crashed shortly after takeoff from Irkutsk-Magan Airport.
The cargo plane crashed into the Caqueta river while attempting to land.

After an aborted landing attempt due to a unlocked landing gear, the plane made a left turn, hit a pole, crashed and burned. Pilot error. Improper use of the throttles by the crew following the go-around. Failure of the landing gear locking mechanism.
While cruising by night, the twin engine aircraft hit the slope of the Cerro El Sabino located near Ciudad Valles.
The cargo plane flew into a thunderstorm and crashed into the sea  in the Gulf of Mexico while en route.
The aircraft hit the slope of Mt Koupé located about 80 km north of Douala. Wreckage found after 10 months.
Ditched into the sea a few km from shore.
The cargo plane crashed while attempting to land.
Lost an engine on takeoff and crashed into trees and caught fire.
The cargo plane lifted off too early, stalled and crashed. The pilot tried to avoid a person on the runway.
Flew into Mount Popa located about 45 km east of Lanywa.
Crashed into the Cameroon mountains after the wing separated due to severe turbulence.
Crashed in adjacent mountains while attempting an emergency landing following an engine fire.
Crashed into the  peak of Mount Charleston 30 miles WNW of Las Vegas during a storm.

tipo_vuelo: Frobisher Bay, Baffin Island - Fort Chimo, Quebec
resumen: Loss of control due to improperly secured heavy cargo breaking loose and sliding to the rear of the aircraft during takeoff.

tipo_vuelo: Frobisher Bay, Baffin Island - Fort Chimo, Quebec
resumen: Crashed on a ferrying flight. Soldier-of-fortune Harold (Whitey) Dahl killed.
Crashed shortly after taking off 15 miles from Aleppo.  Double engine failure during a thunderstorm.
An improper flare on landing caused the aircraft to bounce causing the right wing to strike the runway after which the plane veered off the runway.
During an instrument approach at night the pilot of the cargo plane permitted the aircraft to descend below the approved safety height and this resulted in the aircraft striking the ground.
Crashed shortly after taking off.
The plane struck an object in the water while landing and broke up.

The aircraft touched down at an excessive speed, bounced and stalled. Go-around power was applied, but the remaining runway length was insufficient and the plane overran the end of the runway and went down a steep slope and crashed.
Struck Mt Pindaya near Thazi .

The cargo plane crashed after an attempted go-around. On final, as the pilot-in-command was unable to locate the runway, he decided to make a new go around when the aircraft struck trees and crashed in flames few km short of runway.
While attempting to land, the plane lost air speed and crashed into the sea, 400 yards offshore.
Crashed into Andies peak while en route. Wreckage found 100 miles northeast of Cochabamba.

Shortly after  takeoff, a fire developed in the left main landing gear well. The pilot thought the fire had started in the engine, feathered the No.1 engine and returned for an emergency landing. When he couldn't get the gear down, he performed a go-around after which the left wing separated from the plane. The plane crashed and burned. Fracture of the fuel line in the landing gear housing due to wear against the ribs.

The aircraft was on a charter flight to Livingstone to pick up United Nations troops on leave and take them back to Elizabethville. It took off from Salisbury Airport, and shortly after take-off suddenly dipped its right wing. After a slow recovery, it climbed away to between 100 - 150 ft and then went into a turn to the left with the port propeller windmilling. This turn continued to get steeper until the aircraft rolled over and dived inverted to the ground . The accident was caused by failure of the pilot to execute a successful single engine forced landing after concluding that there had been a power loss in the port engine. Evidence indicated that a failure of the port engine did not, in fact, occur. The pre-take-off rudder trimmer check was not carried out correctly as laid down in the checklist, and the aircraft took off with full left rudder trim applied. Once airborne this was misinterpreted as port engine failure, and the port propeller was feathered. No apparent action was taken by the pilot to correct the ensuing critical speed yaw.

Munson who was practicing takeoffs and landings, allowed the plane to get too low and then slowed the aircraft to 10 knots below safe landing speed.
Crashed due to engine failure on approach.
Crashed into a wooded area after all four engines flamed out. Fuel contamination.
Crashed into the sea after taking off.
Struck high ground in thick fog.
Crashed while attempting touch and go landings.
sin dato
Shifting cargo caused the pilot to lose control and crash into a hotel.
Impacted a mountainside at an altitude of 3400 m.
Crashed into the side of a hill after a go-around.
Struck high ground in poor visibility while en route.
Hit high ground at 2,700 ft. in poor weather while on approach.
Crashed while attemping to land.
Hit by  a U.S. Marine Corps RH-53D Sea Stallion helicopter during a hostage rescue operation while on the ground.
Crashed in the Tapecua mountains.
The cargo plane crashed into a mountain in poor visibility.
Crashed after being struck by lightning
While en route a wing separated from the cargo plane which led to loss of control.  The wing attachment bolts failed in turbulence.
Crashed on takeoff after losing one engine.
Crashed shortly after taking off.
The aircraft broke-up in flight in bad weather.
Crashed into a tug boat and barges while on approach in heavy rain and wind and broke in two.
Separation of a propeller blade caused a forced landing resulting the the plane crashing and burining.
The cargo plane flew into the ground while trying to avoid bad weather.
Shot down by a surface-to-air missile.
Crashed into a mountain at 8,800 feet obscured by clouds.
The aircraft hit the ground shortly after takeoff.

tipo_avion: de Havilland Canada DHC-6 Twin Otter 300
resumen: Flew into a mountain. Controlled flight into terrain.
The aircraft crashed short of the runway while attempting to land after a severe vibration required the crew to shut down the engine and feather the propeller.
The aircraft was unable to gain altitude upon taking off. After turning left the plane struck a hill. Overloaded.

tipo_avion: de Havilland Canada DHC-6 Twin Otter 300
resumen: The aircraft took off, lost altitude, settled back on the runway and overshot the runway. The aircraft was overloaded. Other factors were the pilot misjudged the distance and speed during the takeoff and lack of proper pre-flight planning.
The flight struck a mountain during an emergency descent due to explosive decompression. Crew's failure to follow approved emergency procedures.
Crashed after takeoff.
Engine failed during takeoff. The cargo plane crashed while returning to the field.
The aircraft crashed into high ground 22 km from the airport. Continued VFR flight into IFR condtions.
A malfunction of the No. 1 engine feathering system caused the aircraft to lose control and crash.
Crashed in dirzzle and snow while en route.
Struck Mt. Ipao on Panay Island.
The cargo plane crashed into high ground while on apporach to land.
The plane overran the runway in heavy rain, crashed into a field and burned while attemping to land.
Crashed into a mountain during poor weather conditions.
Lost a wing and crashed.

Takeoff was aborted at V1 when the crew heard unusual sounds from the No.1 engine. The aircraft overran the runway and came to rest against a wall and some vehicles. Misjudged speed and distance and delayed action in aborting the takeoff.

tipo_avion: de Havilland Canada DHC-6 Twin Otter 300
resumen: Hit high ground in poor weather.
The plane ran out of fuel on the third approach in poor weather.
Flew into a mountain while descending for a landing.

tipo_avion: de Havilland Canada DHC-6 Twin Otter 310
resumen: Crashed into a mountain. Flying under VFR in IFR conditions, navigation error and lack of adequate training.

The plane landed 1,725 feet beyond the runway threshold, right wing down, veered to the right until the right propeller struck a 2 to 3 foot snow bank. The blade separated from the engine and penetrated the cabin. Proper alignment not attained by pilot in command. Terrain condition, snow bank. Lack of NOTAM. Improper snow removal.
An overheated APU led to a fire and loss of control of the aircraft.

tipo_avion: de Havilland Canada DHC-6 Twin Otter 300
resumen: Pilot decided to climb and continue to fly VFR in deteriorating weather. The plane crashed in an area of rain, turbulence and thunderstorms. Continued VFR flight in poor weather and a physical impairment due to lack of oxygen when flying at high altitude.

The No.2 engine failed during climbout forcing a return to the airport. While on the  base leg the aircraft lost altitude and crashed. High Pressure fuel pump shaft broke due to pump seizure. The remaining engine could not produce enough power because the fuel datum trimmer wasn't reset in accordance with the flight manual.

tipo_avion: de Havilland Canada DHC-6 Twin Otter 300
resumen: Crashed under unknown circumstances
Crashed into the English Channel.
Crashed into the sea.
After two missed IFR approaches the aircraft struck the ground short of the runway threshold during a third VFR approach.

tipo_avion: de Havilland Canada DHC-6 Twin Otter 300
resumen: Struck trees on high ground after losing the No.1 engine during take off.

tipo_avion: de Havilland Canada DHC-6 Twin Otter 300
resumen: The aircraft touched down short of the runway while on a VFR approach in a snowstorm. The nosegear and one of the main landing gear legs broke away from the fuselage and the aircraft caught fire.
After the No. 2 engine failed on takeoff, the pilot  tried to land but the propellers struck the runway and the aircraft ran off the runway into a ditch.
The aircraft crashed after the elevator failed. Disconnection of the linkage of the elevators control rod.
Crashed into the jungle.
Shortly after the cargo plane took off, the engines began to backfire, the plane lost altitude, the right wing clipped trees and the plane crashed.

Midair collision.  Same aircraft type, same airline. One of 17 killed aboard PT-GKL and all 18 aboard PT-GJZ were killed. PT-GJZ crashed out of control but PT-GKL was able to make a forced landing without its No.1 engine on a river after which it sank.
Crashed into a village approximately 80 miles from Cairo, killing 19 on the ground.

destino: Near Sao Pedro d' Aldeia, Brazil
resumen: The aircraft flew into heavy rain and a cloud shrouded hill after the pilot abandoned IFR and descended VFR. The plane was carrying journalists.
Failure of the No. 4 engine caused the No. 3 engine to failue due to debris. Debris also started a fire in the cargo hatch. The crew was overcome by smoke and cyanide, lost control and crashed.
Crashed into a mountain while en route.
Crashed into Mt. Musaka.
After an engine failed in flight. The crew tried to make an emergency landing but over shot the runway and crashed.
Crashed during takeoff. Overloaded

tipo_avion: de Havilland Canada DHC-6 Twin Otter 100
resumen: Struck a tower while on approach in fog.  Weather was below VFR minima and not reported to the pilot because of a lack of observation and communications facilities at Fort Franklin. The decision of the pilot to continue the approach in fog.
Shot down by enemy fire.
The cargo plane went missing in the Pacific Ocean while en route.

tipo_avion: de Havilland Canada DHC-6 Twin Otter 300
resumen: Crashed into high terrain.
Spatial orientation caused by failure of the artificial horizon.

tipo_avion: de Havilland Canada DHC-6 Twin Otter 300
resumen: Crashed into mountain in poor weather off the intended course.
Crashed after overshooting the runway in rain and fog.
Struck a mountain in poor weather during a third practice approach.
Stalled during a training exercise and crashed.
After an aborted landing attempt the aircraft struck a mountain in poor weather conditions.
The cargo plane lost an engine on talkeoff nosed down and crashed.
After a fuel transfer problem the plane crashed while trying to make an emergency landing in snow. Poor weather and failure of the crew to follow proper procedures with the auxiliary fuel system.
The aircraft's tail struck a hill 1,500 feet from the end of the runway after which an emergency crash landing was made.

The plane stalled and crashed into an emergency vehicle while making an emergency landing attempt after an engine caught fire. A faulty fuel injection nozzle caused a blow torch effect damaging the compressor turbine vane ring and causing thermal fatigue and loss of one of the turbine blades.The resulting imbalance ruptured the starting control bypass fuel return line.

tipo_avion: de Havilland Canada DHC-6 Twin Otter 300
resumen: Unknown circumstances.
Crashed while trying to land with 3 engines.
Shot down by Afghan rebels.
The plane crashed en route after a fire in the No. 1 engine which led to the seperation of the outer wing.
The cargo plane crashed into mountains while en route.
The cargo plane overfew the runway and crashed one mile beyond the end.
Crashed during a test flight. The elevators locked soon after takeoff.
Crashed into a forest.

The plane tried to land at Los Mochis but had to divert to Las Lomitas because of fog. The airport was not approved for commercial flights and the plane crashed into a hill near the airport while attempting to land.
The cargo plane crashed while attempting to make a forced landing.
Crashed into high ground at 1, 900 ft. while flying IFR in rain.
The cargo plane descended below minima weather conditions, undershot the runway, overturned and caught fire.
The jet fighter crashed into a school shortly after taking off after experiencing engine failure.
Crashed short of runway and collided with a building during a sandstorm.
Crashed during takeoff.
Overran the runway and crashed.

While approaching Manado-Sam Ratulangi Airport, the crew encountered marginal weather conditions and failed to realize their altitude was insufficient to clear the slope of Mt Takawirang, located few km from the airport. The aircraft struck to mountain and was destroyed upon impact.
Shot down by Afghan rebels.
The No. 2 engine failed due to severe icing conditions 30 minutes after leaving Lanzhou. With the prop feathered, the plane crashed before reaching the airport.
Ditched into the sea in poor weather conditions.
Stalled and went into a spin during a low-level refueling practice. The stall was propagated by the wake of a B-52.
Shot down by rebels shortly after taking off.

tipo_avion: de Havilland Canada DHC-6 Twin Otter 300
resumen: Crashed into high terrain in poor weather.

tipo_avion: de Havilland Canada DHC-6 Twin Otter 300
resumen: Crashed into a ditch while attempting to land at Ruteng.

tipo_avion: de Havilland Canada DHC-6 Twin Otter 100
resumen: Crashed into a ravine while attempting to land.

The aircraft was doing a drop and pulled up too late. The airplane skidded 1,000 yards down a dirt runway and struck a military vehicle, killing an Army soldier. The plane then impacted trees and broke up.
The landing gear failed after the aircraft touched down 520 meters short of the runway, broke in two and caught fire.
Crashed during takeoff.
Shot down by Afghan rebels on approach.

tipo_avion: de Havilland Canada DHC-6 Twin Otter 310
resumen: The aircraft crashed while attempting to make an emergency landing.
The plane overran the runway while attempting to take off crashed into a building and was destroyed.
The helicopter crashed while attempting to land on an oil rig. Improper planned approach. Clearance not maintained.

resumen: Disappeared between Samarinda and Berau, Indonesia.

Flew into a mountain.
Shot down with a surface-to-air missile.

Crashed on approach.

Crashed on takeoff from Sophia airport en route to Varna. Possible crew error. The stabilizer was set in the full "Down" position, instead it was supposed to be set between 2.5-3 degrees in "the Up" position.
Shot down by a surface-to-air missile.

Accidently struck by a surface-to-air missile by the Polisario.

tipo_avion: de Havilland Canada DHC-6 Twin Otter 300

Hit a mountain.

Midair collision. Five killed on ZA-DAX, ZK-DQF landed safely.
Crashed into Mt. Ringani after being diverted en route to Denpasair, Bali, due to bad weather.
The Antonov crashed after failing to find the destination airport at night.
After the pilot ejected safely, the aircraft crashed into two trucks killing 50 people on the ground.
The cargo plane descended below the minimum safe altitude and struck a 7,000 mountain in poor weather.
During takeoff, close to V1 the takeoff was aborted. The aircraft overran the runway and crashed.
Shot down with a missile fired by UNITA rebels.

tipo_avion: de Havilland Canada DHC-6 Twin Otter 200
resumen: Shortly after taking off, the plane crashed into the ocean three miles south of the Panamanian island of Contadora after experiencing problems with the No. 2 engine leading to loss of altitude and control of the aircraft. The engine failure was caused by bird ingestion.
Struck a ridge in poor weather 35km from Port Morseby while en route to Woltape.
Shot down by rebel forces.
Crashed during an emergency landing.
Crashed into the sea 80nm southwest of its departure point. According to ATC tapes, the crew was being incapacitated by hypoxia prior to crashing.
Crashed into a jungle mountain, Mt. Los Farllones, in poor weather. Controlled flight into terrain.
The helicopter crashed into the sea during a storm.
Undershot the runway by 4km on a second approach, hit powerlines and crashed in fog.

tipo_avion: de Havilland Canada DHC-6 Twin Otter 300
resumen: Crashed into the side of Mt. Paso Macunaa at 5,000 ft. in a jungle region of eastern Ecuador in poor weather. Controlled flight into terrain.

The cargo plane crashed into the Gulf of Finland shortly after taking off.

The aircraft was shot at by drunken police in an attempt to stop it for a search when mistaken for drug smuggling. As the plane ascended through 75 ft. bullets penetrated the forward fuselage killing the pilot and copilot.
Flew into a hillside 7 minutes after taking off from Nogougou. Spatial disorientation.
Ditched into the sea while on approach.
Shortly after takeoff the left engine failed. The aircraft began to lose height in a left turn and crashed along the banks of Mentaya River.

The cargo plane lost engine power due to fuel exhaustion during approach and made a forced landing 1,450m short of the runway.
Crashed into the Gulf of Finland 5 minutes after taking  off. Unknown cause.

tipo_avion: de Havilland Canada DHC-6 Twin Otter 300
resumen: Crashed into Mt. Nashua at 4,100 ft. during a descent in heavy rain and fog while attempting a visual approach. Controlled flight into terrain.
The helicopter was destroyed when it struck Kumaraden Hill at 4,600 ft. while on a scenic flight.  The passengers included EDELCA president and members of his family.
The plane was not able to land at Sampit due to smoke and haze.  The plane held for 3 hours waiting for an improvement after which contact was lost.  The plane was never found.
Crashed into a mountain in zero visibility.

tipo_avion: de Havilland Canada DHC-6 Twin Otter 300
resumen: Crashed during a severe thunderstorm.
The cargo plane crashed into high ground 5 km short of the runway in poor weather during a VFR approach.
Could not land due to a sandstorm, ran out of fuel and made a forced landing in the desert. Crash landed in the desert, 62 miles southeast of Sarra. Among the passengers was Yasser Arafat.
Crashed into the sea after losing the No. 1 engine after reaching 1,500 feet after takeoff.
Crashed into mountains at Daulo Pass, 10km from its destination while on approach in poor weather.
The plane crashed in unstable weather while en route from Manshahr to Tehran.
Cashed and burned after taking off. Fuel starvation.
Overran the runway while trying to take off and crashed into buildings. Overloaded. Center of gravity too far forward.
On approach, the cargo plane went off course while trying to circumnavigate a thunderstorm and impacted a mountain.

tipo_vuelo: La Paz - Santa Ana de Yacuma
resumen: Crashed into a lake in the Chacaltaya mountains during poor weather conditions.

tipo_avion: de Havilland Canada DHC-6 Twin Otter 300
resumen: While en route, one of the aircraft's engines lost power. The pilot declared an emergency and attempted to carry out a forced landing but the aircraft struck trees and crashed.
While attempting to land the nose gear tire blew out causing the plane to veer off the runway, break in three and catch fire. The pilot died after he was trapped in the cockpit.
While taking off the helicopter cashed into trees and burst into flames.
The cargo plane crashed into the Atlantic Ocean while en route.
Crashed short of the runway after attempting an emergency return to the airport after takeoff. Engine failure.
Crashed 45 miles southeast of Lanzhou while attempting to return to the airport after experiencing engine failure.
The cargo plane veered off the runway and crashed while attempting to land at night with just the headlights of several trucks.
The aircraft was descending in heavy rain when it crashed into Mt. Papandayan.

tipo_avion: de Havilland Canada DHC-6 Twin Otter 300
resumen: The float-plane crashed into the lake after experiencing engine failure while en route.
Crashed 1,600m short of the runway threshold while attempting to land at Chita.
After climbing to a height of 800 ft. the plane dove into the ground. Improper loading and overloaded.
Crashed in the Sierra Madre mountains shortly after taking off.
The aircraft flew into high ground at 8,800 ft. while positioning for an approach to Goma.The accident happened in darkness. Premature descet,

The No. 2 engine lost power on takeoff. The aircraft crashed into a swamp 800m beyond the end of the runway, broke up and caught fire.  Flaps were found to be retracted.  Right propeller did not autofeather and had to be feathered manually.
The cargo plane struck a mountain while descending in fog and poor visibility.
While attempting to takeoff the cargo plane overran the runway and struck vehicles. Overloaded.
Crashed into Mt. Kapur 67nm from Medan in poor weather conditions with thunderstorms. The plane has not been found. Pilot was flying at 8,500 ft., below the published minimum safe altitude.
The cargo plane attempted to return to the airport after an engine caught fire but crashed in a field.

The aircraft disappeared shortly before it was due to land and is believed to have crashed into the sea. Prior to the loss of contact, the flight had appeared to be proceeding normally. The accident occurred during daylight and in heavy rain.
Crashed into the sea after departing Caracas on a test flight.
Flew into the side of Marz Mountain while descending.
While landing, undershot the runway and struck a vehicle. Improperly loaded.
The cargo plane crashed under unknown circumstances.

tipo_avion: de Havilland Canada DHC-6 Twin Otter 300
resumen: The cargo plane impacted a hill while on visual approach to El Yopal.
On final approach at low speed the left wing dropped and touched the ground during a stall or deliberate low left turn. The plane cartwheeled and broke up.

tipo_avion: de Havilland Canada DHC-6 Twin Otter 300
resumen: The cargo aboard shifted after takeoff, the plane nosed up, stalled and crashed.

The aircraft ran low of fuel while en route and crashed during the subsequent attempted forced landing on open ground in the jungle. The aircraft strayed off course after encountering poor weather conditions.

A sudden pitch-up during approach led the crew to go-around.  The pitch-up continued until the plane stalled and crashed.  Improperly loaded baggage shifted the center of gravity beyond the acceptable limit.

The plane was on a senic flight of the Mt. Cook area and impacted Franz Josef Glacier at 4,500 ft. The aircraft became trapped in a narrow valley and as the pilot attempted to turn around within the valley the aircraft stalled while it was in a steep bank.
Four minutes after taking off the pilot reported he was having engine problems and was returning. The aircraft subsequently crashed onto a frozen lake, 7.7nm from the airfield in darkness.

Midair collision. The Twin Otter, which was descending inbound to Dakar, collided with a Gambia Airways aircraft which had just taken off. The Twin Otter crashed into the sea. Failure to maintain assigned altitude. Three killed aboard the Twin Otter. The YS-11 was able to land safely.
The plane struck Cerro Carpich at 4,000 ft., 6 minutes after leaving the airport at Tingo Maria.
Crashed into sea after a shell exploded in one of the gun barrells.

tipo_avion: de Havilland Canada DHC-6 Twin Otter 300
resumen: Struck Mt. Lozan, at 13,400 ft. which was obscured by clouds 47 minutes after taking off. Controlled flight into terrain.
Crashed into Mt. Saran 30 minutes before it was scheduled to land in poor weather condtions.
The aircraft was destroyed when it undershot the runway during a visual approach to Sao Gabriel and stuck trees.
Ran off the end of the runway and crashed. The crew used the normal and emergency brake systems at the same time which resulted in the aircraft having no brakes at all.
The helicopter crashed 5 minutes after taking off from Kilo Lima.
Crashed after experiencing engine failure.
Crashed into the sea off of Cozumel while en route in poor weather condtions.  Fuel exhaustion.

tipo_avion: de Havilland Canada DHC-6 Twin Otter 100
resumen: The cargo plane crashed into a mountain a 4,000 ft.
The pilot delayed landing to avoid a pedestrian on the runway, overran the runway and crashed into Saposoa River breaking up.

tipo_avion: de Havilland Canada DHC-6 Twin Otter 300
resumen: The aircraft disappeared while en route from Bima, Sumbawa Island to Ruteng, Flores Island, and crashed into the Molo Strait. The accident occurred in daylight, in poor weather.

The plane flew into a flock of birds that were injested into the left engine.  The pilot soon after reported an engine fire and that he was returning to the airport.  However, control of the plane was lost and the aircraft crashed.
The cargo plane flew into high ground while on approach in poor weather conditons. Controllled flight into terrain.
An engine caught fire shortly after takeoff and the aircraft was not able to make an emergency landing and crashed.
Ditched in the sea just offshore, after losing an engine on approach. The pilot was not rated for that aircraft type and had very little experience.
The cargo plane lost two engines during its flight to Tabubil and subsequent diversion to Kiunga and crashed short of the runway.

tipo_avion: de Havilland Canada DHC-6 Twin Otter 300
resumen: The plane lost control during takeoff in heavy rain and veered off the runway crashing into a banana plantation.
The aircraft, carrying a French medical team, crashed while attempting to land at Antananarivo. Double engine failure.
Shortly after takeoff the plane rolled to the left and struck the ground. Failure of the No. 1 engine.
During the takeoff cargo shifted in the plane causing the aircraft to lose altitude and crash into power lines.
Crashed into Mt. Komawa at 9,200 ft. in poor weather. Found 8/14/95.
Crashed into Nevado de Huila at an elevation of 14,500 feet.

During a low flying turn manuve, at an air show, the pilot caused the plane to stall and crash into the water. The captain made an error in judgement in modifying one of the display manoeuvres to the extent that he stalled the aircraft at a height and attitude from which recovery was impossible.
Crashed after running out of fuel.
Crashed through the ice while attempting to land and sank in shallow water. The weather conditions were below minima and the helicopter exceeded its maximum takeoff weight.
The helicopter crashed into mountains at Barskoon Pass while en route.
Diverted from Madang to Bagasin, overran the runway and crashed.
After losing an engine the plane began to lose altitude and ditched in the Atlantic Ocean 30 km southwest of Bridgetown.
Crashed into the sea while approaching an oil rig to land in strong winds.
After holding for 30 minutes the aircraft undershot the runway during a visual approach and crashed into the sea in heavy fog.
On a positioning flight the aircraft flew into a mountain.

tipo_avion: de Havilland Canada DHC-6 Twin Otter 200
resumen: Crashed into high ground while attempting to land at a mine airstrip in turbulence and stong gusty winds.
Crashed during takeoff.

A straight-in visual approach to Mergui was being attempted when the aircraft entered a squall line of heavy rain. The aircraft then started to lose height quickly, undershot the runway by 800ft. And crashed into a ravine.

destino: Near Bronson Creek, British Columbia, Canada
resumen: After taking off the  No. 2 engine of the cargo plane caught on fire. The pilot tried to land the plane in a river bed. The number 2 engine separated from the aircraft as a result of an intense fire in the wing. The loss of the engine rendered the aircraft uncontrollable, and the pilots were forced to land in the river.

tipo_avion: de Havilland Canada DHC-6 Twin Otter 200
resumen: Crashed on take off.
While attempting to land the landing lights malfunctioned causing the cargo plane to veer off the runway and crash into a house.
Crashed 8km from the airfield after taking off in strong winds and heavy snow.

After being in a holding pattern for over an hour the plane hit trees and a  power line and crashed 700m short of the runway. Failure to maintain the aircraft above the Minimum Descent Altitude while the aircraft was not positioned in the final landing phase.
Crashed short of the runway in dense fog while attempting to land a second time at Lucapa.
The cargo plane became airborne but soon lost altitude and crashed to the ground and burst into flames.
A stray bullet from training soldiers struck the landing plane, hitting an oxygen cylinder. A fire broke out and control of the plane was lost and it crashed.
The aircraft crashed while attemping to land. Windshear. Lack of windshear equipment at the airport.
Shot down by rebels.
Overshot the runway in heavy rain and came to rest in brush.
Collided with a Cessna 206 (OB-1450) and crashed 3 miles from the airfield. Six killed on the Pilatus and 6 on the Cessna

tipo_avion: de Havilland Canada DHC-6 Twin Otter 300
resumen: The aircraft was destroyed when it flew into a hillside during an approach to Uvira.

compañia: Military - Republic of China Air Force
resumen: Crashed in poor weather after a go-around.
Crashed during a landing attempt.
Crashed in the Pastra mountains while searching for the wreckage of an Aerosweet Yak-42 that was missing.
Went missing while en route. May have been shot down.
Shortly after taking off the cargo plane experienced a fire in the No. 2 engine. The plane crashed while attempting to make an emergency landing on a road.
The aircraft crashed into a volcano.

The plane was flying lower than 500 ft. prior to attempting to land. After a missed attempt the plane landed on the water and soon after water entered the cockpit and the plane broke up. Possible collision with debris which caused the doors to collapse inward.

During a training flight, the crew of the cargo plane stopped one engine, stalled and crashed. The loss of control of the aircraft due to an excessive reduction of speed at low height, after having extended the landing gear, with an intermediate flap position, and with the right engine stopped and its propeller pitch close to feather.
Blew a tire while landing causing the plane to to run off the runway and crash.
Shot down by UNITA rebels 30 minutes after taking off.
The aircraft was returning to a ramp with it's brakes on fire when it struck another aircraft and caught fire.
Crashed in the Rwenzori mountains.
The leased aircraft was shot down by UNITA rebels as it flew at FL 150 carrying relief supplies.
he United Nations-chartered plane was shot down by UNITA rebels, 20 minutes after takeoff from Huambo.
After completing an air refueling mission the plane pitched upward, stalled and crashed.
After taking off, the cargo plane lost the No. 3 engine. The crew tried to return to the airport but the plane lost altitude and crashed.
sin dato
The cargo plane was shot down by UNITA rebels.
Experienced pitch oscillations during descent and crashed while landing. Inadequate risk assessment of the pitch feel malfunctions. Overriding of the A/P on the pitch channel by the crew.
The plane crashed just after maintenance personell replaced parts and were testing the plane.
Crashed during a rainstorm.
While on a positioning flight the aircraft crashed into the Black Sea after stating they were diverting to Ankara Turkey.
During a visual approach the aircraft stalled and pancaked 400 ft. short of the runway.
The aircraft, leased from a Ukrainian company, overran they runway and crashed into a ditch after an aborted takeoff. Brake failure as the pilot attempted to avoid a hole in the runway.
The crew reported engine trouble 10 minutes before it crashed while en route. Members of the Liberation Tigers confessed to firing missiles at the plane.
The military flight crashed after losing its engines after striking birds,unable to return to land.
While taking off the plane struck trees at the end of the runway, crashed and burned.
The cargo plane crashed into a cloud covered mountain.
Crashed into the sea during a test flight.

The plane was approaching Tshikapa and the pilot informed the tower that it was having difficulties with its landing gear. The tower told the pilot to do a low fly-by for an evaluation and then make an emergency landing but the pilot refused and attempted to return to Kinshasa. The plane crashed 40 miles north of Tshikapa.
Flew into Mt. Montezuma.
Due to a blown tire on takeoff the pilot aborted the takeoff, overran the runway, came to rest in a cemetery and caught fire.
After losing radio contact with the airport, the aircraft was observed flying low before crashed into a mountainside 2 nm from Jakobkondre.
After an engine failed the crew declared an emergency and elected to divert to Bukavu but crashed 10 km short of the airport.
The plane may have been shot down by Allied Democratic Forces rebels.
While on approach the aircraft struck a hill a few hundred feet short of runway in poor weather.
Crashed 2km short of the runway  from the Luena Airport while attempting to land in heavy rain.
The helicopter crashed in poor weather while on its way to a remote town for the symbolic surrender of arms held by Unita rebels. Two top ranking generals were among those killed in the crash.

Air traffic control lost contact with the aircraft 15 minutes before it was scheduled to land. The wreckage was found atop a 5,300 ft. mountain, surrounded by thick jungle, 5 miles from its destination.
One hour after the takeoff , the the plane disappeared of  Curitiba  ATC. The wreckage was found on a farm, around a crater. Unknown cause.
The aircraft flew into the side of a cliff during it's inaugural flight from Gohu Airstrip in the Finisterre Mountains.
On a positioning flight the plane, over Gabon, had problems with its navigation equipment, circled the airport 4 times before crashing into a wooded hillside.
Crashed in the Atlas mountain range at 9,900 feet while en route.

compañia: Air Taxi - Marco Zero Air Taxi
resumen: Forty miles into it flight the aircraft crashed into the Amazon forest. The aircraft was not certified for IFR flight. Heavy cloud cover existed along the flight route.
After takeoff, the pilot reported low pressure of oil  in an engine and  decided to return to the airport. The plane made a 270 degree turn in the final approach, stalled  and crashed to the ground.

compañia: Air taxi - Rumo Notre Air Taxi
resumen: The plane disappeared shortly after taking off. Wreckage was found at  2 miles south of Gabriel’s runaway,  in the Amazon forest, 2 days later.  Mechanical failure after the takoff.  Remote area without ATC or radar.
While flying in a thunderstorm the plane hit the side of a mountain. One survivor died a few hours after the accident.
Crashed while en route in mountainous terrain.
A forward emergency exit opened in flight causing one of the crew members to be sucked out. An emergency landing was made in Jeddah.
The helicopter was on a counter-narcotics mission when it crashed in heavy fog.
Crashed into mountains and dense forest. The plane lost contact with the tower 30 minutes after taking off from Goma. The wreckage was found at the bottom of a cliff.
Crashed while en route

The aircraft was flying in low cloud and poor weather conditions as it approached the airport at Bukavu when it clipped a mountainside and plunged into the forest in flames 9 miles short of the runway.

tipo_vuelo: Adana, Turkey - Balad Air Base, Iraq
resumen: The cargo plane crashed in fog while attempting to land for a second time at Balad Air Base. After the first attempt to land was aborted, the plane crashed 2.5km short of the runway.The plane was carrying Turkish construction workers.
The helicopter crashed northeast of Baghdad. Shot down by a combination of several heavy machine guns and a shoulder-fired missile

destino: Fazenda Nossa Senhora de Lourdes, Brazil
compañia: Bahia Taxi Aéreo	Bahia Taxi Aéreo	Bahia Taxi Aéreo
resumen: Fifteen minutes before arriving at its destination  the crew informed ATC about a technical problem and that they were losing altitude. Few minutes  later, the twin engine plane crashed into an open field.
While en route to a forest fire, the helicopter crashed into dense forest on a mountain at an altitude of 6,100 feet.
The plane crashed shortly after taking off into a swamp coming to rest upside down. A parliment member of the Democratic Republic of Congo was killed.
Crashed most likely due to a mechanical problem while traveling with a second helicopter.
The cargo plane, carrying palm oil, overshot the runway, crashed into a petrified lava flow and caught fire.
The helicopter crashed 15 miles southeast of Skopje in heavy fog while attempting to land. The aircraft was returning from European Union-led peacekeeping operations in Bosnia.
The military helicopter developed a mechanical problem and crashed into a hill while attemping to land.
The cargo plane crashed while on approach to Isiro-Matari Airport.
The military transport went missing while en route and might have crashed due to heavy rain in the mountainous region.
The military helicopter crashed en route while transporting troops.

The helicopter crashed into a military vehicle shortly after taking off from the military airport carrying seven wounded soldiers and its crew of four soldiers. The accident was reported to have been caused by a technical fault.
The cargo plane experienced an engine failure 5 minutes after taking off causing the aircraft to crash.
The helicopter was flying back to Cusco after conducting aerial surveillance on a possible site for a hydroelectric project near Puno, in southern Peru when it hit the side of a cliff.

The plane disappeared after being taken on an illegal flight. A group of people were having a party at the airfield near the city of Serov, Russia. They  managed to illegally steal an An-2 plane parked at the airfield. The plane went missing and was found on April 4, 2013, 8 km from Serov. Among those killed were the Chief of Serov city police, three police inspectors, the guard of the airport, a private company guard, a pensionist, a young unemployed man and a local mobile shop owner. The pilot was intoxicated at the time of the accident.

destino: Gaurikund, near Kedarnath, Uttarakhand State, India.
resumen: Crashed during flood relief operations. The passengers were from paramilitary forces.

While performing an ambulance flight, the aircraft crashed under unknown circumstances in a wooded area killing 3 passengers and 2 pilots. The lack of control on the part of the company’s management in relation to the flights operating outside of the main base allowed the pilot and the base manager to conduct a flight without the operating sector authorization.

The cargo plane, transporting the mild stimulant known as Khat to the Somali capital, Mogadishu, crashed into a commercial building after taking off from Jomo Kenyatta International Airport. While climbing by night, crew lost control of the aircraft. The probable cause of the accident was the decision by the crew to conduct the flight with a known mechanical problem and their failure to abort or reject the takeoff after receiving twenty-seven cautions.

destino: Near Abu adh Dhuhur Air Base, Syria
resumen: The army transport crashed while attempting to land in fog after hitting electric lines. The Al Nursa front, claimed that it shot down the aircraft.

Three French sports figures, Florence Arthaud, Camille Muffat and Alexis Vastine, participating in the French reality show Droped, were killed along with seven other people when the two helicopters filming the show collided. Five killed on each helicopter

The plane went into a steep descent and crashed onto a field in the mountains of the Kalikot district. The plane was reported to be trying to make an emergency landing. Both the pilot and copilot were killed and nine passengers were injured.
The aircraft was taking part in fire fighting in the region of Bayanday, when under unknown circumstances, it impact trees and crashed in a wooded area.
While completing a training mission, the airplane crashed in unknown circumstances near the Zhengchang village, in the Guizhou Province.
